xyz.fsgik.common.security

Interface FsMac


  • @ThreadSafe
public interface FsMac
    Denotes cipher for MAC generation, maybe has a back Mac.

    It is recommended to use method-chaining: 

         byte[] macBytes = mac.prepare(bytes).key(key).bufferSize(size).mac().doFinal();
    See Also:
    Mac

      Returns new instance of specified algorithm and provider.
      @Nullable javax.crypto.Mac getMac()
      Returns back Mac if it has, or null if it doesn't have one.

      Returns MAC length.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        static FsMac getInstance(java.lang.String algorithm)
        Returns new instance of specified algorithm. Returned instance has a back thread-local Mac which supplied with Mac.getInstance(String).
        Parameters:
        algorithm - specified algorithm
        Returns:
        new instance of specified algorithm

      • getInstance

        static FsMac getInstance(java.lang.String algorithm,
                         java.lang.String provider)
        Returns new instance of specified algorithm and provider. Returned instance has a back thread-local Mac which supplied with Mac.getInstance(String, String).
        Parameters:
        algorithm - specified algorithm
        provider - specified provider
        Returns:
        new instance of specified algorithm

      • getInstance

        static FsMac getInstance(java.lang.String algorithm,
                         java.security.Provider provider)
        Returns new instance of specified algorithm and provider. Returned instance has a back thread-local Mac which supplied with Mac.getInstance(String, Provider).
        Parameters:
        algorithm - specified algorithm
        provider - specified provider
        Returns:
        new instance of specified algorithm

      • getMac

        @Nullable
@Nullable javax.crypto.Mac getMac()
        Returns back Mac if it has, or null if it doesn't have one. The back Mac maybe thread-local, that is, returned value may be not only one instance.
        Returns:
        back Mac if it has, or null if it doesn't have one

        Returns MAC length.

        MAC length

                      int offset,
